supportPages.title: Show, don't tell
supportPages.subtitle: Make your support pages extra clear by adding supporting images.

supportPages.title: Different images in the dark
supportPages.subtitle: Switch your device to dark mode to see a different image

supportPages.title: Video Support
supportPages.subtitle: Supporter supports inline videos, so you can show your users exactly how to use your app.

supportPages.title: Show, don't tell
supportPages.subtitle: Make your support pages extra clear by adding supporting images.

supportPages.title: Different images in the dark
supportPages.subtitle: Switch your device to dark mode to see a different image

supportPages.title: Video Support
supportPages.subtitle: Supporter supports inline videos, so you can show your users exactly how to use your app.

supportPages.title: SupportColors
supportPages.subtitle: Set your apps colors in SupportColors and use the Int associated with the color in your JSON to customize what icons and headers look like.

supportPages.title: SupportColors
supportPages.subtitle: Set your apps colors in SupportColors and use the Int associated with the color in your JSON to customize what icons and headers look like.

supportPages.title: Page 1
supportPages.subtitle: Open the Design file and change the colors however you like. Changing the background requires you to uncomment the init in SupportScreen, which might have issues for other parts of your app if they use Lists as well.

items.title: Add questions with short answers directly on the page
items.text: Users can quickly toggle the answers they want to read.

items.title: Local JSON or load it remotely
items.text: Fallback to a local JSON file in your project, or load localized support data from the web.

items.title: How many questions can go on a page?
items.text: Fallback to a local JSON file in your project, or load localized support data from the web.

items.title: Can I have multiple pages?
items.text: Fallback to a local JSON file in your project, or load localized support data from the web.

items.title: How did you come up with the name 'Supporter'?
items.text: Fallback to a local JSON file in your project, or load localized support data from the web.

items.text: Fallback to a local JSON file in your project, or load localized support data from the web.

items.text: Fallback to a local JSON file in your project, or load localized support data from the web.

items.text: Fallback to a local JSON file in your project, or load localized support data from the web.

items.text: Fallback to a local JSON file in your project, or load localized support data from the web.

items.title: Where should I go on holiday this year?

items.title: Do you know a good work location in Amsterdam?
items.text: Fallback to a local JSON file in your project, or load localized support data from the web.

items.title: Should I go to bed?
items.text: Fallback to a local JSON file in your project, or load localized support data from the web.

items.title: With support for Markdown on iOS 15
items.text: You can use **markdown** to make your ~sentences~ copy shine. You can even add [links](https://goodsnooze.gumroad.com/l/Supporter) inline.

notes.releaseNote: Headers, highlighted items and FAQ toggles
Detail pages with images and videos
Support for Light and Dark Mode
Updated the name from Hooligan to Supporter
